page.title: 07FARMING: W.BILLINGHAM FARM
page.content: The owners of{West Billingham } also own Kingston farm and rent Ramsdown farm.They have 4 workers and 5 tractors for 820 acres of land. West Billingham farm used to grow potatoes but now only grows wheat, barley, and sometimes peas.All the crops go to the big companies in Southampton. The crops are usually sown in the Autumn and harvested in the Summer. Winter barley is harvested first, followed by wheat. Approximately 800 tons of cereal crops are produced each year. On the higher land they have 220 sheep and ewes and 70 beef cattle.
